alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Worcester, southeastern Hampshire, southeastern Franklin and central Hampden Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Granby, or near Amherst, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Torrential downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Chicopee, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, Ludlow, South Hadley, Easthampton, Belchertown, Ware, Granby, Barre, Hadley, North Brookfield, West Brookfield, Hardwick, Oakham, Pelham, Petersham, New Braintree and New Salem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western and central Massachusetts.
